sense.name: a form that has a round, doughnut shape
sense.examples: Bob blew smoke rings with his cigarette. I ordered onion rings with my hamburger. Dolphins make bubble rings in the water and swim through them. The moon has a ring around it tonight. A ring of iron deposit stained the bathtub.

sense.name: an identifiable, characteristic quality
sense.examples: The southern dialogue in his plays has the ring of authenticity. That sales pitch has the ring of a scam. His remarks had the ring of sarcasm.

sense.name: a fastener which is circular but hollow
sense.examples: He tied the horse's reins up to a brass ring in front of the saloon. The biologist put s small ring on each bird's leg, so they could be tracked during migration. The gymnast performed on the rings.

sense.name: a chain of atoms in a molecule forming a closed loop
sense.examples: The enzyme breaks up the carbon rings. These organic molecules contain complex rings of hydrogen, carbon and oxygen.

sense.name: a criminal gang
sense.examples: The police broke up a narcotics ring recently. He's the son of the boss of a famous crime ring. The governor was involved in a New York prostitution ring.

sense.name: a bell_like sound
sense.examples: You are tardy for class if you aren't in your seat at the ring of the bell. We could hear the distant ring of a bell buoy in the bay. Is that ring my cellphone or yours? Fine crystal gives a nice ring when you tap it with your fingernail.

sense.name: a roped platform where boxers or wrestlers contest
sense.examples: The boxer got knocked out in the ring during the third round. The wrestlers stepped into the ring, facing each other.

sense.name: small circular jewelry worn on the body
sense.examples: John and Mary picked out their wedding rings. The girl wore a toe ring on her left foot and a small gold nose ring.
